Event.name: Warning
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> warns an <fen>Addressee</fen> by giving a <fen>Message</fen> that describes an undesirable situation that may affect the <fen>Addressee</fen>. The warning may alternatively be described as about <fen>Topic</fen> pertaining to the undesirable situation, or issued via a specific <fen>Medium</fen>.
<ex><fex name="spe">Jackson</fex> <t>warned</t> <fex name="Addressee">me</fex> <fex name="Message">that the weather could change quickly</fex>, but I guess I didn't really believe him.</ex>
<ex><fex name="spe">We</fex> <t>alerted</t> <fex name="Addressee">officials</fex> <fex name="Topic">about the possibility of containment failure</fex> <fex name="Time">as soon as we realized it could happen</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">They</fex> <m>issued</m> the <t>warning</t> <fex name="Addressee">to only those with the highest security clearence</fex>. <fex name="Topic">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen> to alert the <fen>Addressee</fen> as to possible danger.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Bill</fex> <t>warned</t> me that he would come to the party.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Addressee
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the warning from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
<ex>When did you <t>warn</t> <fex name="Addressee">everyone</fex> about the virus?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Message
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
<ex>The authorities <t>warned</t> me <fex name="Message">that my brother had been arrested</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex>Leroy <t>warned</t> his coworkers <fex name="Topic">about the upcoming audit</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers the warning.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> describes the way the <fen>Speaker</fen> accomplishes the task of warning the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>Do you really think you can effectively <t>warn</t> your friends <fex name="Means">by clanging on bells through the night</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
<ex>The city will now <t>warn</t> residents <fex name="Medium">in text messages and emails</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> warns the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>They <t>warned</t> me <fex name="Time">right away</fex> and everything worked out great.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> warns <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>She was <t>warned</t> about it <fex name="Place">in front of her family</fex>, but it seemed to have no effect.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
<ex>She has yet to <m>receive</m> <fex name="Cf">official</fex> <t>warning</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Descriptor
Arg.definition: <def-root>A characteristic or description of the telling event or of the <fen>Speaker</fen> or <fen>Addressee</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
<ex>I've <t>warned</t> you <fex name="Iterations">enough times</fex> already!</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: warn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: advise someone that something bad might happen to him or her.

lexUnit.name: warning.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a message that informs someone of a potential danger.

lexUnit.name: alert.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a message to inform someone of danger; a warning.

lexUnit.name: forewarn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: warn, give advance notice of the possibility of an undesirable event.
